noun.description: Each of a set of angled slats or flat strips fixed or hung at regular intervals in a door, shutter, or screen to allow air or light to pass through.
examples: murky light filters through the vertical louvers of the window blinds

noun.description: A domed structure on a roof, with side openings for ventilation.

origin: Middle English (in louver (sense 2)): from Old French lover, lovier skylight, probably of Germanic origin and related to lodge.
